added_lines: /* * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; /** * @ngdoc overview * @ngname horizon.cluster.policies.actions * * @description * Provides all of the actions for policies. */ angular.module('horizon.cluster.policies.actions', [ 'horizon.framework.conf', 'horizon.cluster.policies' ]) .run(registerPolicyActions); registerPolicyActions.$inject = [ 'horizon.framework.conf.resource-type-registry.service', 'horizon.app.core.policies.actions.delete.service', 'horizon.app.core.policies.resourceType' ]; function registerPolicyActions( registry, deletePolicyService, policyResourceType ) { var policyResource = registry.getResourceType(policyResourceType); policyResource.batchActions .append({ id: 'batchDeletePolicyAction', service: deletePolicyService, template: { type: 'delete-selected', text: gettext('Delete Policies') } }); policyResource.itemActions .append({ id: 'deletePolicyAction', service: deletePolicyService, template: { text: gettext('Delete Policy'), type: 'delete' } }); } })();

commit_message:
Add details view into Policies panel

This patch adds details view into Polices panel.
Also, adds summary extention into table view.

Change-Id: Ib8954948ee928d40c7090593c05c08b5e64ea90f
Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-policy-table

commit_message:
Add angular policies table

This patch implements policies table based on AngularJS.
As a related patch, I'll implement details view and
create/update/delete actions.

Change-Id: I6cba9bda1795fc57bd636194848e3ff7536be737
Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-policy-table

commit_message:
add tempest plugin base

- drop clients, exception as they don't relate to anything

Change-Id: I455419bd215c45ece19b27317bf10282b48b7a96

subject: Prevent claiming and updating races on worker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 17:05:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/862b5305c5282b7fe3747c0712374cb554ed6319', 'message': "Prevent claiming and updating races on worker

Current code for claiming and updating workers relays on the updated_at
field to determine when a DB record has changed.  This is usually enough
for any DB with sub-second resolution since the likeliness of us having
a race condition is very unlikely.

But not all DBs support sub-second resolution, and in those cases the
likeliness of a race condition increases considerable since we are
working with a 1 second granularity.

This patch completely removes the possibility of having race conditions
using a specific integer field that will be increased on each DB update.
It is compatible with both types of DBMs and will also work with rolling
upgrades.

The reason why we are not using the version counting provided by
SQLAlchemy [1] is because we require an ORM instance to use the feature,
and in some of our usages we don't have an instance to work with, and
adding an additional read query is unnecessarily inefficient.

Additionally we will no longer see spurious errors in unit test
test_do_cleanup_not_cleaning_already_claimed_by_us.

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/versioning.html

Change-Id: Ief9333a2389d98f5d0a11d8da94d160de8ecce0e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 10:19:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1892cf4deeb344298a3685966b30df4247ab065c', 'message': "Prevent claiming and updating races on worker

commit_message:
Prevent claiming and updating races on worker

Current code for claiming and updating workers relays on the updated_at
field to determine when a DB record has changed.  This is usually enough
for any DB with sub-second resolution since the likeliness of us having
a race condition is very unlikely.

But not all DBs support sub-second resolution, and in those cases the
likeliness of a race condition increases considerable since we are
working with a 1 second granularity.

This patch completely removes the possibility of having race conditions
using a specific integer field that will be increased on each DB update.
It is compatible with both types of DBMs and will also work with rolling
upgrades.

The reason why we are not using the version counting provided by
SQLAlchemy [1] is because we require an ORM instance to use the feature,
and in some of our usages we don't have an instance to work with, and
adding an additional read query is unnecessarily inefficient.

Additionally we will no longer see spurious errors in unit test
test_do_cleanup_not_cleaning_already_claimed_by_us.

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/versioning.html

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ief9333a2389d98f5d0a11d8da94d160de8ecce0e

commit_message:
[networking] Add RFC 5737 and 3849 compliance

Update the Networking Guide Introduction section to include compliance
with RFC 5737 and 3849.

Change-Id: Ifd739f9a8b46ca378555c26e5daf26eaff83531e
Related-Bug: #1656378

added_lines: Network address ranges ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The network address ranges used in this guide are chosen in accordance with `RFC 5737 <https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5737>`_ and `RFC 3849 <https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3849>`_, and as such are resticted to the following: IPv4 ---- * 192.0.2.0/24 * 198.51.100.0/24 * 203.0.113.0/24 IPv6 ---- * 2001:DB8::/32 The network address ranges in the examples of this guide should not be usedfor any purpose other than documentation.

commit_message:
Update Networking guide with Placement API config

Routed networks functionality in the Networking service requires the
communication of IPv4 addresses inventory to the Compute scheduler
using the Placement API. This patchset updates the Networking Guide
with instructions on how to configure the communication with the
Placement API.

Change-Id: I1d7816c9958a3bf2f24a08085587ee12e846783d
Closes-Bug: #1657923
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/23/423723/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: segments. The operator must insure that every compute host that is supposed to participate in a router provider network has direct connectivity to one of its segments. The Networking service maintains a host to segment mapping that is used, among other things, The operator should maintain this mapping to assist with#. Configure communication of the Networking service with the Compute scheduler. An instance with an interface with an IPv4 address in a routed provider network must be placed by the Compute scheduler in a host that has access to a segment with available IPv4 addresses. To make this possible, the Networking service communicates to the Compute scheduler the inventory of IPv4 addresses associated with each segment of a routed provider network. The operator must configure the communication between the Networking service and the Compute scheduler. Please see below an example configuration. .. note:: TODO(mlavalle) explain about IPv6. #. TODO(mlavalle) add example of placement API configuration

commit_message:
ironic: agent_* jobs require a partition type of wholedisk

Update the
tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-python3 job
to use a 'wholedisk' partition type as that is required for agent_*
drivers.

Also remove quotes from agent_ipmitool to match the rest of the file.

Change-Id: Ic83f59e1cd159cf5e62ea069b7fb5f6431eb32fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/422927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deploy_driver: agent_ipmitool image-type: wholedisk

commit_message:
ironic: grenade.*multitenant job use agent_ssh

Use the 'agent_ssh' deploy driver. This also requires using the
wholedisk image-type.

The multitenant tests do not currently work with 'pxe_ssh'. Switch to
using 'agent_ssh', like the current multitenant gate job.

Change-Id: I8e20bf7447068560736f6599ff16bb1e40d81208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/17/422917/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deploy_driver: agent_ssh image-type: wholedisk

commit_message:
enable cachetools for gnocchi alarms

- set ttl to an hour since capabilities rarely change (if ever?)
- set cachetools to 1.1.6 since it has some ttl expiration
  improvements and it's a year old so why not.
- i give up trying to disable cache

Change-Id: I1b83ffd32cfd631fc340b068e71f61789388ee73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/28/419628/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # NOTE(sileht): once cachetools is in the requirements # enable it # @cachetools.ttl_cache(maxsize=1, ttl=600)

commit_message:
Adds QoS support

This change adds QoS support for the neutron Hyper-V agent,
leveraging the QoS Neutron extension.

Depends-On: I706368bfcaece380e1357e0c504fd3b9553ba49c
Depends-On: I1dd810e238389456efd4048ebb0bf50f5ea2d237

Implements: blueprint hyperv-neutron-qos
Change-Id: I8f5adfdac7885f98508c80378d1fa467a6d4cf94

added_lines: # Copyright 2017 Cloudbase Solutions Srl # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Unit tests for Windows Hyper-V Qos Driver. """ import mock from hyperv.neutron.qos import qos_driver from hyperv.tests import base class TestQosHyperVAgentDriver(base.BaseTestCase): @mock.patch.object(qos_driver.QosHyperVAgentDriver, '__init__', lambda *args, **kwargs: None) def setUp(self): super(TestQosHyperVAgentDriver, self).setUp() self.driver = qos_driver.QosHyperVAgentDriver() self.driver.utils = mock.MagicMock() @mock.patch.object(qos_driver, 'networkutils') def test_initialize(self, mock_networkutils): self.driver.initialize() mock_networkutils.NetworkUtils.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(qos_driver.QosHyperVAgentDriver, '_get_policy_values') def _check_set_port_qos_rule(self, mock_get_policy_values, method=True): mock_get_policy_values.return_value = mock.MagicMock() mock_policy_data = self.driver._get_policy_values( mock_get_policy_values) if method: self.driver.create({'port_id': mock.sentinel.port_id}, mock.sentinel.qos_policy) else: self.driver.update({'port_id': mock.sentinel.port_id}, mock.sentinel.qos_policy) self.driver.utils.set_port_qos_rule.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.port_id, mock_policy_data) def test_update(self): self._check_set_port_qos_rule(method=False) def test_create(self): self._check_set_port_qos_rule() def test_delete(self): self.driver.delete({'port_id': mock.sentinel.port_id}) self.driver.utils.remove_port_qos_rule.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.port_id) def _check_get_policy_values(self, qos_policy): result = self.driver._get_policy_values(qos_policy) if result == {'min_kbps': None, 'max_kbps': None}: self.assertTrue(result == {'min_kbps': None, 'max_kbps': None}) if result == {'min_kbps': None, 'max_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'max_kbps')}: self.assertTrue(result == { 'min_kbps': None, 'max_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'max_kbps')} ) if result == {'min_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'min_kbps'), 'max_kbps': None}: self.assertTrue(result == { 'min_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'min_kbps'), 'max_kbps': None} ) if result == {'min_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'min_kbps'), 'max_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'max_kbps')}: self.assertTrue(result == { 'min_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'min_kbps'), 'max_kbps': getattr(qos_policy, 'max_kbps')} ) def test_qet_policy_values_both_valid(self): mock_qos_policy = mock.MagicMock() mock_qos_policy.min_kbps = 200 mock_qos_policy.max_kbps = 200 self._check_get_policy_values(mock_qos_policy) def test_get_policy_values_both_invalid(self): mock_qos_policy = mock.MagicMock() mock_qos_policy.min_kbps = None mock_qos_policy.max_kbps = None self._check_get_policy_values(mock_qos_policy) def test_get_policy_values_min_valid_max_invalid(self): mock_qos_policy = mock.MagicMock() mock_qos_policy.min_kbps = 200 mock_qos_policy.max_kbps = None self._check_get_policy_values(mock_qos_policy) def test_get_policy_values_min_invalid_max_valid(self): mock_qos_policy = mock.MagicMock() mock_qos_policy.min_kbps = None mock_qos_policy.max_kbps = 200 self._check_get_policy_values(mock_qos_policy)

commit_message:
archive_policy: provide a boolean storage archive policy by default

Change-Id: I02fe33fa6ba043b68eeed1499596c45cd4be2983
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/61/419561/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: By default, 3 archive policies are created when calling `gnocchi-upgrade`: _low_, _medium_ and _high_. The name both describe the storage spaced and CPU usage needs. A fourth aggregation method named `bool` is also provided by default and is designed to store only boolean values (i.e. 0 and 1). It only stores one data point for each second (using the `last` aggregation method), with a one year retention period. The maximum optimistic storage size is estimated based on the assumption that no other value than 0 and 1 are sent as measures. If other values are sent, the maximum pessimistic storage size is to take into account. - low * aggregation methods used: `default_aggregation_methods` (by default: _mean_, _min_, _max_, _sum_, _std_, _count_) * maximum estimated size per metric: 406 KiB - medium * aggregation methods used: `default_aggregation_methods` (by default: _mean_, _min_, _max_, _sum_, _std_, _count_) * maximum estimated size per metric: 887 KiB - high * aggregation methods used: `default_aggregation_methods` (by default: _mean_, _min_, _max_, _sum_, _std_, _count_) * maximum estimated size per metric: 1 057 KiB - bool * 1 second granularity over 1 year * aggregation methods used: _last_ * maximum optimistic size per metric: 1 539 KiB * maximum pessimistic size per metric: 277 172 KiB
deleted_lines: By default, 3 archive policies are created using the default archive policy list (listed in `default_aggregation_methods`, i.e. mean, min, max, sum, std, count): - low (maximum estimated size per metric: 406 KiB) - medium (maximum estimated size per metric: 887 KiB) - high (maximum estimated size per metric: 1 057 KiB)

commit_message:
Remove workaround to upgrade from 2.2.0

We've released 2.2.1.

Change-Id: I739fd96b53d1271c5183154b6682a82d126ba2f2

deleted_lines: From 7bcd2a259be0a35d9387a24329f55250efde3aec Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com> Date: Mon, 12 Sep 2016 19:54:03 +0200 Subject: [PATCH] ceph: Fix metricd start metricd can be started before api, in that case metricd fail because the measure object don't yet exists. Change-Id: Id7822f16718e31d6a8916cec8a6b77194071a31e --- diff --git a/gnocchi/storage/ceph.py b/gnocchi/storage/ceph.py index 15e1dad..d2ea4f8 100644 --- a/gnocchi/storage/ceph.py +++ b/gnocchi/storage/ceph.py @@ -167,8 +167,12 @@ def _list_object_names_to_process(self, prefix=""): with rados.ReadOpCtx() as op: omaps, ret = self.ioctx.get_omap_vals(op, "", prefix, -1) - self.ioctx.operate_read_op( - op, self.MEASURE_PREFIX, flag=self.OMAP_READ_FLAGS) + try: + self.ioctx.operate_read_op( + op, self.MEASURE_PREFIX, flag=self.OMAP_READ_FLAGS) + except rados.ObjectNotFound: + # API have still written nothing + return () # NOTE(sileht): after reading the libradospy, I'm # not sure that ret will have the correct value # get_omap_vals transforms the C int to python int

subject: Remove support for py33
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-19 02:46:36.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv/commit/7b9cbe09ff3f2189971a995de90196aad44b6961', 'message': 'Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support for the same.

Change-Id: I39bad8d483b69bf6feae6c3f9bf701c37f487709
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support for the same.

Change-Id: I39bad8d483b69bf6feae6c3f9bf701c37f487709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/53/422353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Refactor Access Rules APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 20:29:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/661350135822225e8e3ce855f807d66b1221f8a5', 'message': "Fix Access Rules APIs

- Pull up policy check to beginning of the APIs
- Avoid making access rules changes when one or
  more instances of the share are in an invalid state.
- Add back the per rule share instance access status.
  This restoration provides better visibility for which
  rules were applied successfully.
- Remove 'updating' and 'updating_multiple' as valid
  states for the share instance access rules status.

Access rules for each share instance now transition
from 'new' to 'applying' to 'active' or 'error'; and from
'active', 'new', 'applying' or 'error' to 'deleted'.

Closes-Bug: #1609841
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>
Change-Id: Ic25e63215b5ba723cbc8cab7c51789c698e76f28
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-03 14:57:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/404803ebe0770b31d0e78665ff5b5c64daf9346e', 'message': "Refactor Access Rules APIs

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-29 22:46:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/109898a482c9e34b8edfd38a935903d2c8ea508b', 'message': 'Refactor Access Rules APIs

- Pull up policy check to beginning of the APIs
- Avoid making access rules changes when one or
  more instances of the share are in an invalid state.
- Add back the per rule share instance access status.
  This restoration provides better visibility for which
  rules were applied successfully.
- Remove 'updating' and 'updating_multiple' as valid
  states for the share instance access rules status.
- Deprecate the access rule state 'new' in favor of
  'queued_to_apply' and the share instance access rules
  status 'out_of_sync' in favor of 'syncing'.

Access rules for each share instance now transition
from 'queued_to_apply' to 'applying' to 'active' or 'error';
and from 'active', 'queued_to_apply', 'applying' or 'error'
to 'queued_to_deny' to 'deleted'.

APIImpact
DocImpact

TODO:
Unit tests
Reno
API Microversion changes
Doc changes
Remove 'resync_rules' parameter in the access helper.
Evaluate whether "maintenance mode" is necessary.
Migration cleanup access rules (resync usecase)/change to read-only
Change in-memory locks to state based locks.

Partially-implements: bp fix-and-improve-access-rules
Co-Authored-By: Mike Rooney <rooneym@netapp.com>
Change-Id: Ic25e63215b5ba723cbc8cab7c51789c698e76f28

- Pull up policy check to beginning of the APIs
- Avoid making access rules changes when one or
  more instances of the share are in an invalid state.
- Add back the per rule share instance access status.
  This restoration provides better visibility for which
  rules were applied successfully.
- Remove 'updating' and 'updating_multiple' as valid
  states for the share instance access rules status.
- Deprecate the access rule state 'new' in favor of
  'queued_to_apply' and the share instance access rules
  status 'out_of_sync' in favor of 'syncing'.

In a new API micro-version:
- Allow access rule changes irrespective of the share's
   access_rules_status.
- Expose new access rule states and share's
  access_rules_status values.

Access rules for each share instance now transition
from 'queued_to_apply' to 'applying' to 'active' or 'error';
and from 'active', 'queued_to_apply', 'applying' or 'error'
to 'queued_to_deny' to 'denying' to 'deleted'.

- Pull up policy check to beginning of the APIs
- Avoid making access rules changes when one or
  more instances of the share are in an invalid state.
- Add back the per rule share instance access status.
  This restoration provides better visibility for which
  rules were applied successfully.
- Remove 'updating' and 'updating_multiple' as valid
  states for the share instance access rules status.
- Deprecate the access rule state 'new' in favor of
  'queued_to_apply' and the share instance access rules
  status 'out_of_sync' in favor of 'syncing'.

In a new API micro-version:
- Allow access rule changes irrespective of the share's
   access_rules_status.
- Expose new access rule states and share's
  access_rules_status values.

Access rules for each share instance now transition
from 'queued_to_apply' to 'applying' to 'active' or 'error';
and from 'active', 'queued_to_apply', 'applying' or 'error'
to 'queued_to_deny' to 'denying' to 'deleted'.

commit_message:
Refactor Access Rules APIs

- Pull up policy check to beginning of the APIs.
- Avoid making access rules changes when one or
  more instances of the share are in an invalid state.
- Add back the per rule share instance access status.
  This restoration provides better visibility for which
  rules were applied successfully.
- Remove 'updating' and 'updating_multiple' as valid
  states for the share instance access rules status.
- Deprecate the access rule state 'new' in favor of
  'queued_to_apply' and the share instance access rules
  status 'out_of_sync' in favor of 'syncing'.

In a new API micro-version:
- Allow access rule changes irrespective of the share's
   access_rules_status.
- Expose new access rule states and share's
  access_rules_status values.

Access rules for each share instance now transition
from 'queued_to_apply' to 'applying' to 'active' or 'error';
and from 'active', 'queued_to_apply', 'applying' or 'error'
to 'queued_to_deny' to 'denying' to 'deleted'.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partially-implements: bp fix-and-improve-access-rules
Co-Authored-By: Mike Rooney <rooneym@netapp.com>
Change-Id: Ic25e63215b5ba723cbc8cab7c51789c698e76f28

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """add_share_instance_access_map_state Revision ID: 54667b9cade7 Revises: 48a7beae3117 Create Date: 2016-09-02 10:18:07.290461 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '54667b9cade7' down_revision = '48a7beae3117' from alembic import op from sqlalchemy import Column, String from manila.common import constants from manila.db.migrations import utils # Mapping for new value to be assigned as ShareInstanceAccessMapping's state access_rules_status_to_state_mapping = { constants.STATUS_ACTIVE: constants.STATUS_ACTIVE, constants.STATUS_OUT_OF_SYNC: constants.STATUS_NEW, 'updating': constants.STATUS_NEW, 'updating_multiple': constants.STATUS_NEW, constants.STATUS_ERROR: constants.STATUS_ERROR, } # Mapping for changes to Share Instance's access_rules_status access_rules_status_upgrade_mapping = { constants.STATUS_ACTIVE: constants.STATUS_ACTIVE, constants.STATUS_OUT_OF_SYNC: constants.STATUS_OUT_OF_SYNC, 'updating': constants.STATUS_OUT_OF_SYNC, 'updating_multiple': constants.STATUS_OUT_OF_SYNC, constants.STATUS_ERROR: constants.STATUS_ERROR, } def upgrade(): op.add_column( 'share_instance_access_map', Column('state', String(length=255), default=constants.STATUS_NEW) ) connection = op.get_bind() share_instances_table = utils.load_table('share_instances', connection) instance_access_table = utils.load_table('share_instance_access_map', connection) instances_query = ( share_instances_table.select() .where(share_instances_table.c.status == constants.STATUS_AVAILABLE) .where(share_instances_table.c.deleted == 'False') ) for instance in connection.execute(instances_query): access_rule_status = instance['access_rules_status'] op.execute( instance_access_table.update().where( instance_access_table.c.share_instance_id == instance['id'] ).values({ 'state': access_rules_status_to_state_mapping[ access_rule_status], }) ) op.execute( share_instances_table.update().where( share_instances_table.c.id == instance['id'] ).values({ 'access_rules_status': access_rules_status_upgrade_mapping[ access_rule_status], }) ) def downgrade(): op.drop_column('share_instance_access_map', 'state')

commit_message:
Fixes congress.conf.sample file generation

Fixes array name and CONF registering issue that prevented
tox -egenconfig from correctly generating the
congress.conf.sample file.
Refactored to move dse_opts into config.py.

Closes-Bug: 1657620
Partial-Bug: 1651928

Change-Id: I4057de278323373ea45653276fb5b243eb673e2f

commit_message:
Fix JSON serialization error with sqlachemy storage backend

When using gnocchi collector, some description fields can contain
Decimal, which leads to JSON serialization error in the sqlalchemy
storage.

This patch add a custom JSONEncoder to ensure Decimal to float
conversion (No computation is done with those values)

Change-Id: I525592329670b5696310aae0b9569a3f789be43c
Closes-bug: 1658095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/21/423321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DecimalJSONEncoder(json.JSONEncoder): """Wrapper class to handle decimal.Decimal objects in json.dumps().""" def default(self, obj): if isinstance(obj, decimal.Decimal): return float(obj) return super(DecimalJSONEncoder, self).default(obj) desc = json.dumps(frame['desc'], cls=DecimalJSONEncoder)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/01/424001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2017-01-22 09:38+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2017-01-23 03:21+0000\n""Each network namespace also has its own routing table, and in fact this is " "the main reason for namespaces to exist. A routing table is keyed by " "destination IP address, so network namespaces are what you need if you want " "the same destination IP address to mean different things at different times " "- which is something that OpenStack Networking requires for its feature of " "providing overlapping IP addresses in different virtual networks." msgstr "" "Setiap namespace jaringan juga memiliki tabel routing sendiri, dan " "sebenarnya ini adalah alasan utama untuk namespace ada. Sebuah tabel routing " "diketik dengan alamat IP tujuan, sehingga namespace jaringan menjadi apa " "yang Anda butuhkan jika Anda ingin alamat IP tujuan yang sama dengan kata " "lain hal yang berbeda pada waktu yang berbeda - namespace merupakan sesuatu " "dimana OpenStack Networking perlu mengetahui fitur-fiturnya yang menjadi " "sumber alamat IP yang tumpang tindih di berbagai jaringan virtual." msgid """In a network namespace, the scoped 'identifiers' are network devices; so a " "given network device, such as ``eth0``, exists in a particular namespace. " "Linux starts up with a default network namespace, so if your operating " "system does not do anything special, that is where all the network devices " "will be located. But it is also possible to create further non-default " "namespaces, and create new devices in those namespaces, or to move an " "existing device from one namespace to another." msgstr "" "Dalam namespace jaringan, scoped 'identifiers' adalah perangkat jaringan; " "sehingga perangkat jaringan tertentu, seperti ``eth0``, ada dalam namespace " "tertentu. Linux memulai dengan namespace jaringan default, jadi jika sistem " "operasi Anda tidak melakukan sesuatu yang istimewa, itulah namespace tempat " "semua perangkat jaringan akan berlokasi. Tetapi juga namespace itu mungkin " "membuat non-default namespace lebih lanjut, dan menciptakan perangkat baru " "pada namespace itu, atau memindahkan perangkat yang ada dari satu namespace " "ke namespace yang lain." msgid ""

Send mail tool

user stored in the config file with information regarding the
results of a tempest run.

Implements: blueprint send-mail-tool

commit_message:
Fix token expire wich may happen in using clients

Add a new way to create clients, which usees session and can solve the
bug that the token may expire during protecting works. Then we can create
client once and use it all the time(<48h) without worry that the token may
expire.

Change-Id: I411972f9415409b2a97b958cc1dda52794d78468
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
Partial-Bug: #1566793

commit_message:
Don't bail webpack by default

bail: true option in webpack.config.js causes webpack to stop building
which is not convenient for development process, as webpack command
then needs to be restarted. For dev we want to keep webpack running so
when problem is fixed, it gets automatically recompiled and browser
refreshed

--bail option should be enough for build
process where we want webpack to fail incase of error.

Related-Bug: 1654051
Change-Id: Id8ce7a2d08b8cd9e3efa5dc51a3eb6cb9ba15efe

commit_message:
Add heat metadata checksum fix for AIO-type network config

Port 8000 is the heat metadata url that some heat resources
use for running heat-related hooks inside an instance.
Without this rule communication between the instance and the
service will fail.

This patch adds the checksum fix to the script implemented
in https://review.openstack.org/326396

Change-Id: I4aaec3f2921c2341dfd57577995e32c9ef038f2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/90/423290/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! ${IPTABLES} -C POSTROUTING -t mangle -p tcp --sport 8000 -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill 2> /dev/null; then ${IPTABLES} -A POSTROUTING -t mangle -p tcp --sport 8000 -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill fi if ! ${IP6TABLES} -C POSTROUTING -t mangle -p udp --sport 8000 -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill 2> /dev/null; then ${IP6TABLES} -A POSTROUTING -t mangle -p udp --sport 8000 -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill fi

commit_message:
Return support status in profile type show

This patch enables senlin engine/api to return support status in profile
type show. This feature needs to be enabled by API micro-version
1.5.

Change-Id: I7a4bcdaaa857d776d926bbbfde3c517f05d8935b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/78/418678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key = 'support_status' if req.version_request <= vr.APIVersionRequest("1.4"): # We return supporte-status from 1.5 if key in content: content.pop(key)

subject: Switch to Nova v2.32 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 13:25:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ec2-api/commit/af50da8a0f561e0e0baf79844b7d6321df902723', 'message': "Switch to Nova v2.32 API

At v2.33 new bdm field 'tag' was introduced. This field is automatically
created by snapshot operation for volume backed instance (ebs). The
result of the operation - bdm - is stored in metadata of the snapshot
image. When ec2api user requires to run an instance with this image
changing some attributes of the attached volume (e.g.
delete_on_termination), this bdm is merged with user defined parameters
and sent to Nova. As the result the new 'tag' field is sent to Nova
since v2.32.

However the used API version is v2.10, which does not support 'tag'
field. This did not lead to faults (until I56348dc2) because Nova
verified the first bdm only, but the first bdm for ebs instances was a
bdm for the image. With the noted fix this no more works.

This patch swithes ec2api to use v2.32 to get 'tag' field supported.

Change-Id: I68329bbffeeff5d460f3fca1a212ba20b35fc284

commit_message:
Switch to Nova v2.32 API

At v2.33 new bdm field 'tag' was introduced. This field is automatically
created by snapshot operation for volume backed instance (ebs). The
result of the operation - bdm - is stored in metadata of the snapshot
image. When ec2api user requires to run an instance with this image
changing some attributes of the attached volume (e.g.
delete_on_termination), this bdm is merged with user defined parameters
and sent to Nova. As the result the new 'tag' field is sent to Nova
since v2.32.

However the used API version is v2.10, which does not support 'tag'
field. This did not lead to faults (until I56348dc2) because Nova
verified the first bdm only, but the first bdm for ebs instances was a
bdm for the image. With the noted fix this no more works.

This patch swithes ec2api to use v2.32 to get 'tag' field supported.

Change-Id: I68329bbffeeff5d460f3fca1a212ba20b35fc284
(cherry picked from commit 480dc02de0d8413aa518a23b22a0140013df1350)
(cherry picked from commit 4deceadc272b212003bc9cee8161a82757c6ef64)

Remove /var/lib/ceph from updatedb

This stops updatedb from indexing the storage locations

Change-Id: Idd77f0fc087a06af874d2865bfec8c319a0b15dd
Closes-bug: 1520226

added_lines: # This file is owned by the Ceph charm and could be replaced at any time PRUNE_BIND_MOUNTS="yes" # PRUNENAMES=".git .bzr .hg .svn" PRUNEPATHS="/tmp /var/spool /media /home/.ecryptfs /var/lib/schroot /var/lib/ceph" PRUNEFS="NFS nfs nfs4 rpc_pipefs afs binfmt_misc proc smbfs autofs iso9660 ncpfs coda devpts ftpfs devfs mfs shfs sysfs cifs lustre tmpfs usbfs udf fuse.glusterfs fuse.sshfs curlftpfs ecryptfs fusesmb devtmpfs"

subject: Honor Nova's restriction for bdm fields
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 13:25:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ec2-api/commit/7b20d6377de128fad1d104e00dad671e93f0e823', 'message': "Honor Nova's restriction for bdm fields

Nova does not allow None values for bdm fields. However it stores them
in image metadata for volume bdm during snapshot operation of volume
backed instance. Ec2Api sends them back to Nova during run instance
operation, which violates Nova's restriction.

Here we cut out None values from image bdms before use it.

Change-Id: Ice913c935e288f1cb615443324c05ca3c31efca6
(cherry picked from commit 239464ab7453c183e0494c4e52679d06102bfdda)

commit_message:
Honor Nova's restriction for bdm fields

Nova does not allow None values for bdm fields. However it stores them
in image metadata for volume bdm during snapshot operation of volume
backed instance. Ec2Api sends them back to Nova during run instance
operation, which violates Nova's restriction.

Here we cut out None values from image bdms before use it.

Change-Id: Ice913c935e288f1cb615443324c05ca3c31efca6
(cherry picked from commit 239464ab7453c183e0494c4e52679d06102bfdda)
(cherry picked from commit 9434a2a1ace4df9e4e06a752fd45e2ce3258c499)

commit_message:
Switch to Nova v2.32 API

At v2.33 new bdm field 'tag' was introduced. This field is automatically
created by snapshot operation for volume backed instance (ebs). The
result of the operation - bdm - is stored in metadata of the snapshot
image. When ec2api user requires to run an instance with this image
changing some attributes of the attached volume (e.g.
delete_on_termination), this bdm is merged with user defined parameters
and sent to Nova. As the result the new 'tag' field is sent to Nova
since v2.32.

However the used API version is v2.10, which does not support 'tag'
field. This did not lead to faults (until I56348dc2) because Nova
verified the first bdm only, but the first bdm for ebs instances was a
bdm for the image. With the noted fix this no more works.

This patch swithes ec2api to use v2.32 to get 'tag' field supported.

Change-Id: I68329bbffeeff5d460f3fca1a212ba20b35fc284
(cherry picked from commit 480dc02de0d8413aa518a23b22a0140013df1350)

commit_message:
Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support for the same.

Change-Id: Ib92e8ee8c7e7ba43537772b30d98e67b3df17685

commit_message:
OVO for Ipam(Allocation,Subnet,Pool)

This patch introduces and integrates Oslo-Versioned Objects for
IpamAllocationPool,IpamAllocation and IpamSubnet model classes.

Change-Id: Ib7d86dd10e92b5e2baeef0e69620c8688859fe7d
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Co-Authored-By: Anindita Das <anindita.das@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohit Malik <mohit.malik@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>

commit_message:
remove monasca libs

Removes the monasca libs since they are not compatible with the new
kafka.

We need to raise kafka version, because the current one is deprecated
since a while and oslo.messaging kafka driver requires a new version.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/108350.html

Change-Id: If8dccc1726209ffb22cbc8e3db019ab05d4426a5

added_lines: ex = self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.client.trigger_action, 'clusters', self.cluster_id, params) message = ex.resp_body['error']['message'] self.assertEqual("Value must be >= 0 for field 'count'.", str(message)) class TestClusterScaleOutInvalidRequest(base.BaseSenlinAPITest): @decorators.idempotent_id('7aa3fd0c-c092-4a54-8dae-3814492101b0') def test_cluster_scale_out_invalid_count(self): params = { "scale_out": { "count": "bad-count" } } # Verify badrequest exception(400) is raised. ex = self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.client.trigger_action, 'clusters', 'fake', params) message = ex.resp_body['error']['message'] self.assertEqual( "invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'bad-count'", str(message)) ex = self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.trigger_action, 'clusters', 'b7038d95-204c-455f-a866-94dc535dd840', params) message = ex.resp_body['error']['message'] self.assertEqual( "The cluster 'b7038d95-204c-455f-a866-94dc535dd840' could " "not be found.", str(message))

In ba67b3aff8bdcf1ce951d1f61e69ba19799a09fc validation of Workflow and

commit_message:
Allow hyphens in Workflow and ad-hoc action names

In ba67b3aff8bdcf1ce951d1f61e69ba19799a09fc validation of Workflow and
Action names was fixed. This had the unintended side effect of making
the validation much stricter. This change adds hyphens to the allows
characters.

Change-Id: Ib05c4988ea3dbeaf5f29f5f5674a606b3c652f2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/99/423299/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NON_VERSION_WORD_REGEX = "^(?!version$)[\w-]+$"

subject: Add oslo_debug_helper to tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 11:22:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cloudkittyclient/commit/2211d48f725b4f5e092e28b44d49105960a4a604', 'message': 'Add oslo_debug_helper to tox.ini

oslo_debug_helper is used to assist in debugging of python code,
i.e. by adding breakpoints via pdb.

To enable debugging, run tox with the debug environment:
tox -e debug <test_path>

Reference link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html#debugging-with-oslo-debug-helper

Change-Id: I01d66328a3529e542e503be2cd7bbca69a77c4aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add oslo_debug_helper to tox.ini

oslo_debug_helper is used to assist in debugging of python code,
i.e. by adding breakpoints via pdb.

To enable debugging, run tox with the debug environment:
tox -e debug <test_path>

Reference link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html#debugging-with-oslo-debug-helper

Change-Id: I01d66328a3529e542e503be2cd7bbca69a77c4aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cloudkittyclient refs/changes/52/420652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:debug] commands = oslo_debug_helper {posargs}

subject: Fix replication freeze mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 16:07:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4b201b2ee61c43d4f061480ae1933a74ba8c0198', 'message': "Fix replication freeze mechanism

Freeze functionality in the replication feature doesn't work as
expected, since it is not being used on the scheduler to exclude
backends or used on the API or volume nodes so API-to-Vol operations
like delete and extend will also work.

This patch fixes the freeze mechanism by excluding frozen backends in
the scheduler and checking the if the service is frozen on all other
modifying operations.

Closes-Bug: #1616974
Change-Id: I4561500746c95b96136878ddfde8ca88e96b28c6

like delete and create snapshot will also work.

This patch fixes the freeze mechanism by excluding frozen backends in
the scheduler and checking the if the service is frozen on all other
modifying operations.

Since extend operation now goes through the scheduler it will be frozen
there.

Closes-Bug: #1616974

commit_message:
Fix replication freeze mechanism

Freeze functionality in the replication feature doesn't work as
expected, since it is not being used on the scheduler to exclude
backends or used on the API or volume nodes so API-to-Vol operations
like delete and create snapshot will also work.

This patch fixes the freeze mechanism by excluding frozen backends in
the scheduler and checking the if the service is frozen on all other
modifying operations.

Since extend operation now goes through the scheduler it will be frozen
there.

Closes-Bug: #1616974
Change-Id: I4561500746c95b96136878ddfde8ca88e96b28c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/23/402923/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not unmanage_only: volume.assert_not_frozen() volume.assert_not_frozen() if not unmanage_only: snapshot.assert_not_frozen() volume.assert_not_frozen()

commit_message:
Serialize mtu for dpdk interface with 'i40e' driver

On NIC: XL710 with driver 'i40e'  MTU does not take into
account 4 bytes VLAN tag, so we should increase it manually

DocImpact
Change-Id: I3d95db9ec6fae4d8cd397c429d785dbdf1502b21
Partial-Bug: #1587310
Co-Authored-By: Fedor Zhadaev <fzhadaev@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 737556d)

added_lines: dpdk_cpu_pinning=0, nic_driver=None): if nic_driver: dpdk_nic.driver = nic_driver if nic_driver: self.assertEqual(dpdk_interface['mtu']['value']['value'], consts.DEFAULT_MTU + consts.SIZE_OF_VLAN_TAG) def test_serialization_with_dpdk_with_i40e_driver(self): driver = 'i40e' dpdk_cpu_pinning = 4 self._check_dpdk_serializing(nic_driver=driver, dpdk_cpu_pinning=dpdk_cpu_pinning)

commit_message:
Modification of mounted volume check

Remote ssh execution returns object with bash outputs.
Elements in "stdout" of "ls" command contains '\n'
endings. So test assert was changed to fix false fail.

Change-Id: I241750d970a6634cb60c0ab905f0e4b7030834ec
Closes-Bug: 1618022
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/13/423113/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 16. Check that volume was mounted logger.info("Check that volume was mounted") 'sudo mount | grep "/dev/vdb on /mnt"', assert_true(out['stdout'] and out['exit_code'] == 0, "Volume was not mounted") assert_true("file-on-volume\n" in out['stdout'], self.show_step(7, node, True)
deleted_lines: 16. Mount the volume after migration net_name = self.fuel_web.get_cluster_predefined_networks_name( cluster_id)['private_net'] logger.info("Mount volume after migration") 'sudo mount /dev/vdb /mnt', logger.info("out of mounting volume is: {:s}".format(out['stdout'])) assert_true("file-on-volume" in out['stdout'], self.show_step(7, node)

commit_message:
Add 'extern' physical network create supported

1. What is the problem
when creating an external network with provider physical
network specified as 'extern', central Neutron will complain
that the specified physical network is not found.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add 'extern' as physical network to Q_ML2_PLUGIN_VLAN_TYPE_OPTIONS
when init local neutron variables.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I3948bcc8b4498ad2f3a14679fbed9ce8ae3ad113
Closes-Bug: #1657634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/74/422574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vlan_option="bridge:$TRICIRCLE_DEFAULT_VLAN_RANGE" ext_option="extern:$TRICIRCLE_DEFAULT_EXT_RANGE" Q_ML2_PLUGIN_VLAN_TYPE_OPTIONS=(network_vlan_ranges=$vlan_option,$ext_option)

commit_message:
Add an uniform way to manage external network

Since dragonflow only supports one external network, we can manage it
in an uniform way. All the fullstack tests can use this external network.

Change-Id: I0c09d4b9ce23935100d2568fe45fb2948c875b76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/86/423786/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.agent.common import utils as agent_utilsfrom dragonflow.tests.fullstack import test_objects as objects if not self.get_external_network(): self.create_external_network() def get_external_network(self): external_net = objects.find_first_network(self.neutron, {'router:external': True}) return external_net def create_external_network(self): # We can create a "logical" external network, which can spawn # floatingip in local host. params = {'name': 'public', 'router:external': True} self.neutron.create_network(body={'network': params}) network_id = self.get_external_network()['id'] external_subnet_para = {'cidr': '172.24.4.0/24', 'ip_version': 4, 'network_id': network_id, 'enable_dhcp': False} self.neutron.create_subnet(body={'subnet': external_subnet_para}) # The script for neutron l3 will create br-ex as external bridge, # we need to assign the gw_ip to the bridge and bring it up. agent_utils.execute("ip addr add 172.24.4.1/24 dev br-ex".split(" "), run_as_root=True) agent_utils.execute("ip link set br-ex up".split(" "), run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I23436d3d16a6c68653f054cdb23b6d4aa3eed653

commit_message:

commit_message:
[Core] Credential add domain_name

We use `rally deployment create --fromenv` to create deployment.
But not  add 'domain_name' in object.Credential.
And in keystone_v3, keystone-client maybe need it.

Change-Id: I1d5542b81f9187098857c0d2ac9dc5b49da2441c

commit_message:
Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support and add py35 for the same.

Change-Id: I9248235fc5892362531f465259b3eb40abfc9d7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient refs/changes/95/423895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
lbaasv2: Use the rest api for member status retrieval

Instead of the topology api.  After the recent MidoNet
changes [1], member status is not available via the
topology api.  Instead, it's available via the Rest API. [2]

Also, stop importing topology api modules to avoid import
errors caused by protobuf version incompatibilites.

Also, temporarily disable a few L3 unrelated unit tests to
pass the gate.

[1] Ia51366c0be1fc8e853e2bf66184e30150f017f84
[2] I8175eee553045190d04711b9b6499304fcb2e4d8

Related-Bug: #1658454
Change-Id: I86864b125f0ea6d824ec6276843c1c560ca0056b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/92/416892/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: In order to retrieve pool member status updates from the backend and update the neutron database, the topology API must be enabled, configured, and a socket opened to retrieve this information. To do this, use the `mn-conf` utility to set the configuration:: mn-conf set cluster.topology_api.enabled=true mn-conf set cluster.topology_api.port=TOPOLOGY_API_PORT mn-conf set cluster.topology_api.socket_enabled=true The TOPOLOGY_API_PORT defaults to 8081 if not set explicitly. To set the topology API server and port, add the following to the *[midonet]* section of the Neutron configuration file ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``:: [midonet] cluster_ip = CLUSTER_SERVER cluster_port = TOPOLOGY_API_PORT By default, `cluster_ip` is "localhost" and `cluster_port` is 8081.

commit_message:
Remove mox in nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py (2)

Stop using mox in method ShelveComputeManagerTestCase._shelve_offload

Partially implements: blueprint remove-mox-ocata

Change-Id: I08f86e9fb89c069af6ad751c04538adaaf24892f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/342593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, '_update_resource_tracker') @mock.patch.object(nova.network.api.API, 'cleanup_instance_network_on_host') @mock.patch.object(nova.virt.fake.SmallFakeDriver, 'power_off') @mock.patch.object(nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, '_get_power_state', return_value = 123) @mock.patch.object(nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, '_notify_about_instance_usage') def _shelve_offload(self, mock_notify_instance_usage, mock_get_power_state, mock_power_off, mock_cleanup, mock_update_resource_tracker, clean_shutdown=True): # prepare expect call lists mock_notify_instance_usage_call_list = [ mock.call(self.context, instance, 'shelve_offload.start'), mock.call(self.context, instance, 'shelve_offload.end')] mock_notify_instance_usage.assert_has_calls( mock_notify_instance_usage_call_list) # instance.host is replaced with host because # original instance.host is clear after # ComputeManager.shelve_offload_instance execute mock_cleanup.assert_called_once_with(self.context, instance, host) mock_get_power_state.assert_called_once_with(self.context, instance) mock_update_resource_tracker.assert_called_once_with(self.context, instance) if clean_shutdown: mock_power_off.assert_called_once_with(instance, CONF.shutdown_timeout, self.compute.SHUTDOWN_RETRY_INTERVAL) else: mock_power_off.assert_called_once_with(instance, 0, 0)
deleted_lines: def _shelve_offload(self, clean_shutdown=True): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute, '_notify_about_instance_usage') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute.driver, 'power_off') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute, '_get_power_state') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute.network_api, 'cleanup_instance_network_on_host') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute, '_update_resource_tracker') self.compute._notify_about_instance_usage(self.context, instance, 'shelve_offload.start') if clean_shutdown: self.compute.driver.power_off(instance, CONF.shutdown_timeout, self.compute.SHUTDOWN_RETRY_INTERVAL) else: self.compute.driver.power_off(instance, 0, 0) self.compute.network_api.cleanup_instance_network_on_host( self.context, instance, instance.host) self.compute._get_power_state(self.context, instance).AndReturn(123) self.compute._update_resource_tracker(self.context, instance) self.compute._notify_about_instance_usage(self.context, instance, 'shelve_offload.end') self.mox.ReplayAll()

Allow admins to get resource by physical resource id

This change allows admin users to get resources from
other projects by physical resource id.

Partial-Bug: #1649759

commit_message:
Missing parameter for storage pools in Pure Storage driver

Storage pools requires a manadatory parameter called
QoS_support. This is missing in the Pure Storage driver
so we will add it with the value of False
Also add parameter to unit test.

Fixes bug 1635342

Change-Id: I9f81f72fddf85ed7dee920ae48bea7f9707d4744
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/389844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data['QoS_support'] = False

commit_message:
Sync ``services`` SQLA model with what's in the DB

``replication_status`` is VARCHAR(36) in the DB, but VARCHAR(255) in the
SQLAlchemy model. This commit synchronizes that in the model.

Change-Id: Ie978c7de98484b7249e2918ef00ea3bbd43c0b78
Closes-Bug: 1652263
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/27/414527/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: replication_status = Column(String(36), default="not-capable") frozen = Column(Boolean, default=False)
deleted_lines: replication_status = Column(String(255), default="not-capable") frozen = Column(Boolean, nullable=False, default=False)

commit_message:
Add sahara constraints

Add few constraints for better stack validation.
Also, refactor old sahara constraint tests to
make everything more compact.

Change-Id: I7157fdc7077bddfda432a40f2597463ae23577bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/47/375847/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_job_binary_by_id(self, jb_id): try: return self.client().job_binaries.get(jb_id) except Exception as ex: if self.is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity="Job Binary", name=jb_id) raise ex def get_cluster_by_id(self, cluster_id): try: return self.client().clusters.get(cluster_id) except Exception as ex: if self.is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity="Cluster", name=cluster_id) raise ex def get_data_source_by_id(self, ds_id): try: return self.client().data_sources.get(ds_id) except Exception as ex: if self.is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity="Data Source", name=ds_id) raise ex def get_cluster_template_by_id(self, ct_id): try: return self.client().cluster_templates.get(ct_id) except Exception as ex: if self.is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity="Cluster Template", name=ct_id) raise ex class JobBinaryConstraint(SaharaBaseConstraint): resource_getter_name = 'get_job_binary_by_id' class ClusterConstraint(SaharaBaseConstraint): resource_getter_name = 'get_cluster_by_id' class DataSourceConstraint(SaharaBaseConstraint): resource_getter_name = 'get_data_source_by_id' class ClusterTemplateConstraint(SaharaBaseConstraint): resource_getter_name = 'get_cluster_template_by_id'

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of shell

Using ansible systemd module to daemon reload and service reload
is the solution for the future. Let's embrace it!

Change-Id: I702a10266bec2e2b34f60abcd60159f34d2cacd3
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/24/422624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: systemd: daemon_reload: yes
deleted_lines: - name: Reload systemd daemon command: "systemctl daemon-reload" notify: - Restart ceilometer services service:

commit_message:
Remove conversion of 'retry_interval' parameter

'retry_interval' parameter is already defined as IntOpt in
conf.instance.py so there is no need to explicitly convert
this parameter to int and float.

Trivial Fix

Change-Id: I8201dd4c80a6b74fcf630e9b349ff26ed84b5626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari-monitors refs/changes/08/421908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _post_event(self, event): retry_max = CONF.callback.retry_max retry_interval = CONF.callback.retry_interval time.sleep(retry_interval) self._post_event(event)
deleted_lines: def _post_event(self, retry_max, retry_interval, event): time.sleep(int(retry_interval)) retry_max = CONF.callback.retry_max retry_interval = float(CONF.callback.retry_interval) self._post_event(retry_max, retry_interval, event)

commit_message:
Allow auth url without port for vim registration

This patch allows vim-register command to register keystone
URL without port.

Change-Id: Ie04a0253aa3f42ef532ccf8a7bddbbd1f88e3e34
Closes-bug: 1618756
(cherry picked from commit 3b60ab1aaa4750af17d5fed1b56c13d75c7807b4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tackerclient refs/changes/45/423545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparsedef validate_url(url): url_parts = urlparse.urlparse(url) if not url_parts.scheme or not url_parts.netloc or not url_parts.port: raise exceptions.TackerClientException(message='Invalid URL') return url_parts

subject: Fix: Creation of cluster without floating ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-09 05:02:15.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/v1/baymodels_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_baymodels_shell.py', 'magnumclient/v1/cluster_templates_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_clustertemplates_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/d7ad21fd38b996d601015d9f93102580522d55d9', 'message': 'Fix: Creation of cluster without floating ip

Currenlty passing the parameter --floating-ip-enabled
while creating cluster template has no effect. By
default cluster is created with floating ip enabled,
so user should have a way to disable it.
This patch renames the parameter --floating-ip-enabled
to --floating-ip-disabled.
User can now pass --floating-ip-disabled while
creating cluster template to disable floating ip.

Change-Id: I41560623a3f6bcb66cc5f09e994a7a899f8ee8a5
Closes-Bug: #1639119
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Creation of cluster without floating ip

Currenlty passing the parameter --floating-ip-enabled
while creating cluster template has no effect. By
default cluster is created with floating ip enabled,
so user should have a way to disable it.
This patch renames the parameter --floating-ip-enabled
to --floating-ip-disabled.
User can now pass --floating-ip-disabled while
creating cluster template to disable floating ip.

Change-Id: I41560623a3f6bcb66cc5f09e994a7a899f8ee8a5
Closes-Bug: #1639119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/00/395400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--floating-ip-disabled ')

commit_message:
Improvement to get group detail(Part 2)

This feature allows users to query group details
with volume ids which are in this group.

According to the spec, this is part 2 to implement the whole bp.
This patch add the "volumes" field to group detail and group
show if user specifies the querying argument 'list_volume=True'.

This change will add a new version "3.25".

APIImpact
GET /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}?list_volume=True
RESP BODY: {"group": {"status": "XXX",
                      "id": "XXX",
                      ...,
                      "volumes":['volume_id1',
                                 ...,
                                 'volume_idn']
                     }
           }

Co-Authored-By: wanghao<sxmatch1986@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ica1afd07cd022bab168b6894b9cf43a5b18e34d4
Implements: blueprint improvement-to-query-consistency-group-detail

commit_message:
Fix missing translations for log messages

Fixed log translations for info messages with appropriate marker
function according to the oslo.i18n guidelines[1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id600f520a832a8180c09ebf9fcf94e3d93504a37

commit_message:
Provide unified _show_resource() for senlin resources

Adds the base class for senlin resources, and override
the method _show_resource() in the base class, all
senlin resources can use it.

Change-Id: If900aa5ff60e1c79ce5e3c1edaa9d15f177751b1
Blueprint: refactor-show-resource
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/00/420500/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine.resources.openstack.senlin import res_base class Profile(res_base.BaseSenlinResource): entity = 'profile'
deleted_lines: from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support class Profile(resource.Resource): support_status = support.SupportStatus(version='6.0.0') default_client_name = 'senlin' def _show_resource(self): profile = self.client().get_profile(self.resource_id) return profile.to_dict()

commit_message:
Implement Share Migration Ocata improvements

- Added 'preserve-snapshots' parameter
- Driver-assisted parameters are now mandatory (thus
compatibility with previous versions is broken)
- Updated parameter descriptions

Change-Id: Icfdefdee88040464d19ab95dba50b88c8f90a1d3
Depends-On: I764b389816319ed0ac5178cadbf809cb632035b4
Implements: blueprint ocata-migration-improvements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/06/406306/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version = api_versions.APIVersion('2.23') result = manager.migration_start( share, host, True, True, True, False, True) "preserve_snapshots": True,
deleted_lines: version = api_versions.APIVersion('2.22') result = manager.migration_start(share, host, True)

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I6a6280e454a9af0f70cf1b4ae6a02e9647a2c0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/08/423008/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -- Options for Internationalization output ------------------------------ locale_dirs = ['locale/']

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: Ifb4e89f729f4901ebacf59322efe742d169c963d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-onos refs/changes/19/423019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -- Options for Internationalization output ------------------------------ locale_dirs = ['locale/']

commit_message:
Add cinder backend driver for Huawei FusionStorage

It will support the minimum set of features required in Cinder:
  - Volume Create/Delete
  - Volume Attach/Detach
  - Snapshot Create/Delete
  - Create Volume from Snapshot
  - Get Volume Stats
  - Copy Image to Volume
  - Copy Volume to Image
  - Clone Volume
  - Extend Volume

DocImpact
Implements: bp fusionstorage-cinder-driver

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Change-Id: I26a809adb7bef4370eb53c634dc9bae0c74b4a8a

') return manage_ip except Exception, e: LOG.debug(_("get manage ip failed,error=%s") % six.text_type(e)) finally: fsc_file.close() else: LOG.debug(_("fsc conf file no exist,file_name=%s") % (fsc_conf_file)) def get_dsw_manage_ip(self): return manage_ip def execute(self, cmd): result = None try: result = os.popen(cmd).readlines() LOG.debug(_("result is %s") % result) return result except Exception, e: LOG.error("execute cmd failed,error=%s" % six.text_type(e)) return None finally: pass def start_execute_cmd(self, cmd, type): fsc_ip = self.get_ip_port() manage_ip = self.get_manage_ip() ip_num = len(fsc_ip) LOG.debug(_("fsc_ip is %s") % fsc_ip) if ip_num <= 0: return None if ip_num > 3: ip_num = 3 exec_result='' result='' if type: for ip in fsc_ip: cmd_args = CMD_BIN + cmd + ' --manage_ip ' + manage_ip.replace('
', '') + ' --ip ' + ip.replace('
', '') LOG.debug(_("DSWARE cmd_args is %s") % cmd_args) exec_result = self.execute(cmd_args) if exec_result: for line in exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', line): return exec_result elif re.search('^result=50150007', line): return 'result=0' elif re.search('^result=50150008', line): return 'result=0' elif re.search('^result=50', line): return exec_result return exec_result else: for ip in fsc_ip: cmd_args = CMD_BIN + cmd + ' --manage_ip ' + manage_ip.replace('
', '') + ' --ip ' + ip.replace('
', '') LOG.debug(_("DSWARE cmd_args is %s") % cmd_args) exec_result = self.execute(cmd_args) if exec_result: for line in exec_result: if re.search('^result=', line): result=line if re.search('^result=0', line): return line elif re.search('^result=50150007', line): return 'result=0' elif re.search('^result=50150008', line): return 'result=0' elif re.search('^result=50', line): return line return result def create_volume(self, vol_name, pool_id, vol_size, thin_flag): cmd = '--op createVolume' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + vol_name + ' ' +\ '--poolId' + ' ' + str(pool_id) + ' ' + '--volSize' + ' ' + \ str(vol_size) + ' ' + '--thinFlag' + ' ' + str(thin_flag) exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def extend_volume(self, vol_name, new_vol_size): cmd = '' cmd = ('--op expandVolume' + ' ' + '--volName') \ + (' ' + vol_name + ' ' + '--volSize' + ' ' + str(new_vol_size)) exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def create_volume_from_snap(self, vol_name, vol_size, snap_name): cmd = '--op createVolumeFromSnap' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + \ vol_name + ' ' + '--snapNameSrc' + ' ' + snap_name + ' ' + '--volSize' + \ ' ' + str(vol_size) exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def create_fullvol_from_snap(self, vol_name, snap_name): cmd = '--op createFullVolumeFromSnap' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + vol_name + ' ' + '--snapName' + ' ' + snap_name exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def create_volume_from_volume(self, vol_name, vol_size, src_vol_name): retcode = 1 tmp_snap_name = str(vol_name) + '_tmp_snap' retcode = self.create_snapshot(tmp_snap_name, src_vol_name, 0) if 0 != retcode: return retcode retcode = self.create_volume(vol_name, 0, vol_size, 0) if 0 != retcode: self.delete_snapshot(tmp_snap_name) return retcode retcode = self.create_fullvol_from_snap(vol_name, tmp_snap_name) if 0 != retcode: self.delete_snapshot(tmp_snap_name) self.delete_volume(vol_name) return retcode return 0 def create_clone_volume_from_volume(self, vol_name, vol_size, src_vol_name): retcode = 1 tmp_snap_name = str(src_vol_name) + '_DT_clnoe_snap' retcode = self.create_snapshot(tmp_snap_name, src_vol_name, 0) if 0 != retcode: return retcode retcode = self.create_volume_from_snap(vol_name, vol_size, elif re.search('^status=', line): local_volume_info['status'] = line[len('status='):] elif re.search('^vol_size=', line): local_volume_info['vol_size'] = line[len('vol_size='):] elif query_volume(self, vol_name): tmp_volume_info = volume_info cmd = '--op queryVolume' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + vol_name exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd,1) if exec_result: for line in exec_result: if re.search('^result=', line): if not re.search('^result=0', line): tmp_volume_info['result'] = line[self.res_idx:] return tmp_volume_info for line in exec_result: if re.search('^vol_name=' + vol_name, line): tmp_volume_info = self.volume_info_analyze(line) if str(0) == tmp_volume_info['status']: tmp_snap_name = str(vol_name)+'_tmp_snap' self.delete_snapshot(tmp_snap_name) return tmp_volume_info tmp_volume_info['result'] = 1 return tmp_volume_info def delete_volume(self, vol_name): cmd = '--op deleteVolume' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + vol_name exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def create_snapshot(self, snap_name, vol_name, smart_flag): cmd = '--op createSnapshot' + ' ' + '--volName' + ' ' + vol_name + \ ' ' + '--snapName' + ' ' + snap_name + ' ' + '--smartFlag' + ' ' \ + str(smart_flag) exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): return 0 else: return exec_result[self.res_idx:] else: return 1 def snap_info_analyze(self, info): local_snap_info = snap_info.copy() if not info: local_snap_info['result'] = 1 return local_snap_info local_snap_info['result'] = 0 snap_info_list = [] snap_info_list = re.split(',', info) for line in snap_info_list: line = line.replace('

', '') if re.search('^result=', line): if not re.search('^result=0', line): result = int(line[self.res_idx:]) break for one_line in exec_result: if re.search('^pool_id=', one_line): tmp_pool_info = self.pool_info_analyze(one_line) pool_list.append(tmp_pool_info) break return (result, pool_list) def query_dsware_version(self): retcode = 2 cmd = '--op getDSwareIdentifier' exec_result = self.start_execute_cmd(cmd, 0) if exec_result: #new version if re.search('^result=0', exec_result): retcode = 0 #old version elif re.search('^result=50500001', exec_result): retcode = 1 #failed else: retcode = int(exec_result[self.res_idx]) return retcode def main(): testAPI = FSPythonApi() recode = testAPI.create_volume('vol_1', 0, 1024, 0) print "create volume result:%s" % (str(recode)) time.sleep(2) recode = testAPI.extend_volume('vol_1', 10240) print "extend volume result:%s" % (str(recode)) recode = testAPI.create_snapshot('snap_1','vol_1',0) print "create snapshot result:%s" % (str(recode)) time.sleep(2) recode = testAPI.create_volume_from_snap('vol_2', 1024, 'snap_1') print "create volume from snapshot result:%s" % (str(recode)) time.sleep(5) recode = cmp('0',vol_info['result']): print "query volume info:" for key,value in vol_info.items(): print key +"="+str(value) else: print "query volume result:%s" % (vol_info['result']) time.sleep(1) snap_info = testAPI.query_snap('snap_1') if cmp('0',snap_info['result']): print "query snap info:" for key,value in snap_info.items(): print key +"="+str(value) else: print "query snap result:%s" % (snap_info['result']) time.sleep(1) recode = testAPI.delete_snapshot('snap_1') print "del snapshot result:%s" % (str(recode)) time.sleep(1) recode = testAPI.delete_volume('vol_1') print "del volume vol_1 result:%s" % (str(recode)) recode = testAPI.delete_volume('vol_2') print "del volume vol_2 result:%s" % (str(recode)) recode = testAPI.delete_volume('vol_3') print "del volume vol_3 result:%s" % (str(recode)) time.sleep(1) test_pool_info = testAPI.query_pool_info(0) if cmp('0',test_pool_info['result']): print "query pool info:" for key,value in test_pool_info.items(): print key +"="+str(value) else: print "query pool result:%s" % (test_pool_info['result']) if __name__ == "__main__": main()

commit_message:
Fix puppet example in README

keystone_password is reomved in ceilometer::api, use password instead.
ceilometer::rabbit_host, ceilometer::rabbit_password,
ceilometer::rabbit_userid are deprecated. Use
ceilometer::default_transport_url instead

Change-Id: Iab2341f8e14193616768cdb1787031b89cfa158a

commit_message:
Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support for the same.

Change-Id: I0c23960c413d74433b5cc96473b9e61ae6112577

commit_message:
Elevate the _send_packet method

Since it will be used by other classes(its sub classes), _send_packet
should not have the prefix "_".

Since ryu will serialize the packet, we can let ryu do the job. So all
the calls the serialize() are removed.

Change-Id: Icd63aa62d9a2e7c6465bc4ef1b15fc5ab72361bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/54/422554/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove checking if datapath is None

The ryu_base_app module will wait for datapath to be not None, in
its start method. That means all dragonflow apps can trust datapath
to be not None. So, checking if datapath is None makes no sense.

Change-Id: Ifec1dbe9b4e9f2a59be6973886f5068a8c0bde6d

commit_message:
[user-guide] revert to nova client command

For openstackclient not including provisions for --block-device
flag, it is better to use nova client to boot an instance from an
ISO image.

-Add commands reported from the bug, and note on the nova client,
and booting an instance from an ISO image.

Change-Id: Ib5d425fa1521c2cc99e6b35074039c0f713cd93f
Closes-Bug: #1656132
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/19/419719/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: make such instances functional, use the :command:`nova boot` $ nova boot --image ubuntu-14.04.2-server-amd64.iso \ --block-device source=blank,dest=volume,size=10,shutdown=preserve \ --nic net-id = NETWORK_UUID \ --flavor 2 INSTANCE_NAME
deleted_lines: make such instances functional, use the :command:`openstack server create` $ openstack server create \ --image ubuntu-14.04.2-server-amd64.iso \ --block-device source=blank,dest=volume,size=10,shutdown=preserve \ --nic net-id = NETWORK_UUID \ --flavor 2 INSTANCE_NAME

commit_message:
Fix incorrect test class name

test_instance_failure_flow module is intended to have instance failure
recovery test cases. Changed the class name from HostFailureTestCase
to InstanceFailureTestCase.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iff20bd4d3c14a3d1d226f90659aa08b9c4e6f2b5

commit_message:
Remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the
default value. It's not necessary to set it
again when defining config options.

Change-Id: I9fc33e44fdf038684195a19027255ce1bfe61dc6
Closes-bug: #1323975

the `host` field.

Now cluster listings accepts new filtering fields `replication_status`,
`frozen`, and `active_backend_id`.

also return `frozen` and `active_backend_id`.

This patch adds new methods to our failover mechanism to allow failover
to work when a backend is clustered.

Adds REST API microversion 3.19 that adds a new `failover` method
equivalent to `failover_host` but accepting `cluster` field as well as
the `host` field.

Thaw and Freeze are updated to update cluster and all services within
the cluster.

Now cluster listings accepts new filtering fields `replication_status`,
`frozen`, and `active_backend_id`.

also return `frozen` and `active_backend_id`.

commit_message:
Make Replication support Active-Active

This patch adds new methods to our failover mechanism to allow failover
to work when a backend is clustered.

Adds REST API microversion 3.26 that adds a new `failover` method
equivalent to `failover_host` but accepting `cluster` field as well as
the `host` field.

Thaw and Freeze are updated to update cluster and all services within
the cluster.

Now cluster listings accepts new filtering fields `replication_status`,
`frozen`, and `active_backend_id`.

Summary listings return `replication_status` field and detailed listings
also return `frozen` and `active_backend_id`.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/401392

APIImpact: New service failover action and new fields in cluster listings.
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Id3291b28242d5814c259283fa629b48f22e70260
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/35/381835/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cluster_name, services = objects.ServiceList.get_all( ctxt, filters={'host': host, 'cluster_name': cluster_name, 'binary': constants.VOLUME_BINARY}) if not services: msg = _('Service not found with') if host: msg += ' host=%(host)s' if cluster_name: msg += ' cluster_name=%(cluster)s' raise exception.ServiceNotFound(msg, host=host, cluster=cluster_name) changed = [] not_changed = [] for service in services: result = service.conditional_update( {'replication_status': fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILING_OVER}, expected) if not result: not_changed.append(service) else: changed.append(service) if not_changed: expected = utils.build_or_str(expected['replication_status']) msg = (_('Host replication_status in %(service)s must be ' '%(expected)s to failover.') % {'service': [s.service_topic_queue for s in not_changed], 'expected': expected}) for service in changed: service.status = fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILOVER_ERROR service.save() self.volume_rpcapi.failover_host(ctxt, service, secondary_id)
deleted_lines: svc_host = volume_utils.extract_host(host, 'backend') service = objects.Service.get_by_args( ctxt, svc_host, constants.VOLUME_BINARY) result = service.conditional_update( {'replication_status': fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILING_OVER}, expected) if not result: expected_status = utils.build_or_str( expected['replication_status']) msg = (_('Host replication_status must be %s to failover.') % expected_status) self.volume_rpcapi.failover_host(ctxt, host, secondary_id)

subject: Add offset support for paginate_query in karbor
revisions:

commit_message:
Add offset support for paginate_query in karbor

The parameter offset is not processed in the paginate_query
method. The patch could fix it.

Change-Id: Ieba7004df93522fda1570b8abfcff5ce0ff5e0e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/26/423626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: query = sqlalchemyutils.paginate_query(query, paginate_type, limit, if offset: query = query.offset(offset) return query

commit_message:
Fix create trust failed

It may fail to create trust when creating a new scheduled
operation. Because keystone client can not find the endpoint
of keystone service which should exist in the context when
'include_service_catalog = True'.

Change-Id: I30346935c911ec88e256852eaac40b43e28455f9
Closes-Bug: #1649789

added_lines: def _do_test_aggregation(self, name, v1, v2): ts = carbonara.TimeSerie.from_tuples( [(datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 0, 0), 3), (datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 0, 4), 6), (datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 0, 9), 5), (datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 1, 4), 8), (datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 1, 6), 9)]) ts = self._resample(ts, 60, name) self.assertEqual(2, len(ts)) self.assertEqual(v1, ts[datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 0, 0)]) self.assertEqual(v2, ts[datetime.datetime(2014, 1, 1, 12, 1, 0)]) def test_aggregation_first(self): self._do_test_aggregation('first', 3, 8) def test_aggregation_last(self): self._do_test_aggregation('last', 5, 9) def test_aggregation_count(self): self._do_test_aggregation('count', 3, 2) def test_aggregation_sum(self): self._do_test_aggregation('sum', 14, 17) def test_aggregation_mean(self): self._do_test_aggregation('mean', 4.666666666666667, 8.5) def test_aggregation_median(self): self._do_test_aggregation('median', 5.0, 8.5) def test_aggregation_min(self): self._do_test_aggregation('min', 3, 8) def test_aggregation_max(self): self._do_test_aggregation('max', 6, 9) def test_aggregation_std(self): self._do_test_aggregation('std', 1.5275252316519465, 0.70710678118654757)
